content.description:
Start on crimps under and left of the arete.  Reach right for a good hold, then sneak up the arete to the top.

(* name might not be from FA)
content.protection: The landing is multi-level and a bit heady.
content.location:
This is the arete right of

Mikala

.

content.description: This route may be quite a bit harder if you are short, but there is cool beta there that is worth the challenge.
content.location:
Left of

Malice

, sit start with a left hand edge and a right hand blocky sidepull. Climb straight up through two good edges near the lip of the boulder.

content.description:
Spite is one of the easier problems in the area. Do a long move to crimps at the lip and then better holds to top out.

(I picked some names that were related to revenge for these problems, for now, but please let me know accurate FA info.)
content.location:
This is on the far left, on the same boulder as

Revenge

.

content.description:
In the Revenge corridor, a boulder leans against the wall.  Start on jugs in a horizontal seam and traverse right on good hands and poor feet, under the leaning boulder to finish on the same topout as

Revenge

.

(I picked some names that were related to revenge for these problems, for now, but please let me know accurate FA info.)
content.location:
Start left and traverse right to finish same place as

Revenge

.

content.description: Sit start in the back of the overhang and move up and left using heel hooks.  The farther left you go at the end, the easier it is to top out.
content.protection: Watch that rock below and behind you.
content.location: Revenge is the rightmost problem on the boulder.

content.description: This is a one move wonder.  Sit with poor feet, use an okay left hold and sidepull for the right.  Then a big move up and right to a decent, somewhat sharp, flat spot.  Once you stick it, move up and left on obvious holds and much easier moves to the top.
content.location:
This is in the main area, 50 feet from the Bots, 30 feet from

Revenge

.

content.description:
Start sitting with a somewhat awkward, R hand undercling, and move left to a matchable, diagonal hold.  Then change the feet and work up on better holds.  There's a rock close behind your back as you top out on great holds.

(I picked some names that were related to revenge for these problems, for now, but please let me know accurate FA info.)
content.protection: Pad the rock behind, as well as the landing.
content.location:
This is the second route from the left on the same boulder as

Revenge

.

content.description: Start low on a right hand undercling and a left hand sidepull. The first few moves are tough, then utilize a crack to top out.
content.protection: Pads and spotter. The top isn't hard, but the landing could be bad.
content.location:
To the left of

Revenge

, look for vertical crack. Sit down and find a chalked undercling.

content.description: Climb big, powerful moves through a steep face.
content.protection: Small pads. There's a bit of a dab factor.

content.description: Start on crimps about head height, move up right, and follow the arete up the boulder.

Sit start on two thin, slanted crimps and do a big move to the good holds in the horizontal seam.  Then continue up and left following intermitent holds in a seam (crimp out L) to the jug hole just below the lip.

(I picked some names that were related to revenge for these problems, for now, but please let me know accurate FA info.)
content.protection: Extra pads can close up the gap below and behind you, easing your mind.
content.location:
This is left of

Revenge

, just past the boulder leaning against the wall.
